definition: pedant
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology
after all/to investigate/to study carefully/Taiwan pr. [jiu4]

sentences.english: Why should pedants be allowed to spoil the game?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼要讓學究們破壞了我們的遊戲？

sentences.english: The habit of mind or manner characteristic of a pedant.
sentences.chinese: 迂腐的言行心理或行爲帶有學究氣的習性。

sentences.english: Historians are for the most part very scholarly men nowadays .
sentences.chinese: 現今的歷史學者大多是些學究氣十足的人。

sentences.english: These were mostly detached and scholarly documents.
sentences.chinese: 這大都是一些孤立的，學究式的文件。

sentences.english: His essays can be Oxbridge musty.
sentences.chinese: 他的隨筆或許帶有陳腐的學究氣。

sentences.english: He had a haunted look about him.
sentences.chinese: 他外表有點學究氣，相當害羞。

sentences.english: They deviated little from the scholastics in tackling the standard problems.
sentences.chinese: 他們在處理典型問題時和經院派學究相差甚微。

sentences.english: Pedants sneer at an education, which is useful.
sentences.chinese: 學究們藐視教育，但教育卻是有益的。

sentences.english: The old pedant used so many archaisms that half of what he said was unintelligible.
sentences.chinese: 你是個只會誇誇其談的學究，親愛的夥計。

sentences.english: They are too serious, too academic and not imaginative enough.
sentences.chinese: 他們太一本正經，太學究氣，想象力也不夠豐富。

sentences.english: The article tastes of the schools.
He had all the illumination of wisdom and none of its pedantry .
sentences.chinese: 他具有智慧的一切光輝，卻沒有絲毫學究的迂腐氣息。

sentences.english: She's always shown an academic turn of mind.
sentences.chinese: 她總是表現出學究式的思想方法。

definition: to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
lit. enough books to make a pack-ox sweat or to fill a house to the rafters (idiom); fig. many books
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to speak face to face/meeting/interview
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
feudal times
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
calligraphic style of Liu Gongquan
old school/conservative faction
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to be chivalrous
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
